key.label: Key
key.description: (String) A unique identifier for internal purposes.

name.label: Name
name.description: (String) A unique name that identifies the block (without namespace). For example ‘testimonial’. Note: A block name can only contain lowercase alphanumeric characters and dashes, and must begin with a letter.

title.label: Title
title.description: (String) The display title for your block. For example ‘Testimonial’.

description.label: Block Description
description.description: (String) (Optional) This is a short description for your block.

category.label: Category
category.description: (String) Blocks are grouped into categories to help users browse and discover them. The core provided categories are [ common | formatting | layout | widgets | embed ]. Plugins and Themes can also register custom block categories.

icon.label: Icon
icon.description: (String|Array) (Optional) An icon property can be specified to make it easier to identify a block. These can be any of WordPress’ Dashicons, or a custom svg element.

keywords.label: Keywords
keywords.description: (Array) (Optional) An array of search terms to help user discover the block while searching.

post_types.label: Post Types
post_types.description: (Array) (Optional) An array of post types to restrict this block type to.

mode.label: Mode
mode.description:
(String) (Optional) The display mode for your block. Available settings are “auto”, “preview” and “edit”. Defaults to “preview”. auto: Preview is shown by default but changes to edit form when block is selected. preview: Preview is always shown. Edit form appears in sidebar when block is selected. edit: Edit form is always shown.

			Note. When in “preview” or “edit” modes, an icon will appear in the block toolbar to toggle between modes.

align.label: Align
align.description: (String) (Optional) The default block alignment. Available settings are “left”, “center”, “right”, “wide” and “full”. Defaults to "full".

supports.label: Supports
